content: I am a Robotics PhD student advised by Prof.Panagiotis Tsiotras in the Institute of Robotics and Intelligent Machines (IRIM) at Georgia Tech, USA. Currently, I am working on intelligent exploration techniques for sampling-based motion planning. My research area lies at the exciting intersection of A.I and heuristics, Machine learning and optimal-control theory. I graduated from IIT-Madras in 2017 with a Bachelor’s and Master’s in Engineering Design, where I worked on planning and control of autonomous ground vehicles with Prof.Shankar Ram C S.

title: Sagar Suhas Joshi

summary: An optimization based sampling technique for planning of higher dimensional robots
title: LES: Locally Exploitative Sampling for Robot Path Planning

summary: An intelligent exploration technique for efficient sampling-based kino-dynamic planning of robots such as quadrotors.
title: TIE: Time-Informed Exploration For Robot Motion Planning

content: Sampling-based planners are particularly effective in handling higher dimensional search-spaces as in case of robotic manipulators. I use ROS+OMPL+MoveIt! to develop and test my planning algorithms for such robotic arms.
title: Manipulators

content: We are developing a complete ROS software stack for autonomous navigation of the MIT RACECAR robot. Please find a video of car in simulation here. The car uses LiDAR and odometry data for SLAM. Variant of A* or a sampling-based algorithm such as RRT*, RRT# is used for path planning.
summary: ROS Software stack for autonomous driving
title: Autonomous Car

authors: Sagar Suhas Joshi and Panagiotis Tsiotras
summary: An efficient exploration algorithm for planning over cost-maps. This can be applied to robots such as the Mars rover, which needs to avoid rough/danger terrains while exploration and manipulator arms, which need to perform dexterous motions.
title: Relevant Region Exploration On General Cost-maps For Sampling-Based Motion Planning

authors: Sagar Suhas Joshi and Panagiotis Tsiotras
summary: A Non-Parametric approach to sampling in the L2 Informed Set for Motion Planning
title: Non-Parametric Informed Exploration for Sampling-Based Motion Planning

summary: Lane keeping performance, passenger comfort and safety are considered to calculate a index of performance for the driver
title: A vehicle dynamics based algorithm for driver evaluation
